thread.title: ASEAN hopes to expedite code of conduct on South China Sea - Singapore

title: ASEAN hopes to expedite code of conduct on South China Sea - Singapore
text:
February 7, 2018 / 1:52 AM / Updated 32 minutes ago ASEAN hopes to expedite code of conduct on South China Sea - Singapore Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - The Association of Southeast Asian Nations is hoping to expedite negotiations on a code of conduct framework with China for the disputed South China Sea, but it wasn’t realistic to expect an agreement within a year, Singapore’s defence minister said on Wednesday. 
China and the 10-member ASEAN bloc adopted a negotiating framework on the code and have already commenced talks on the issue. 
Singapore’s Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen was speaking to reporters following a gathering of ASEAN defence chiefs. Reporting by Fathin Ungku, writing by Jack KimEditing by Shri Navaratnam
